Gender: Male

Age: 5

MRN: 867175

Diagnosis: Budd-Chiari syndrome

History and Physical:

Patient: Ive been feeling a lot of abdominal distention again, doctor. It's causing a lot of discomfort.

Doctor: I see. Can you tell me a bit more about how long you've been experiencing this issue?

Patient: It started around 3 years ago, along with a fever. At first, I was treated for abdominal TB at a

local  hospital  for  about  a  year.  After  that,  I  was  okay  for  two  years,  but  then  the  same

symptomsfever  and  abdominal  distentioncame  back.  I  saw  Dr.  Nagina  Shahzadi  who  gave  me

antibiotics, but things didnt improve much, so I was referred to Childrens Hospital Lahore for further

treatment.

Doctor: And what happened at Childrens Hospital?

Patient: I was admitted for about 15 days, and after several investigations, they diagnosed me with

Budd  Chiari  Syndrome  based  on  a  CT  scan  and  ultrasound  of  my  abdomen.  They  also  had  to  do

multiple taps during my stay.

Doctor: Got it. Have you experienced any decompensations since then?

Patient: Yes, Ive had jaundice and ascites.

Doctor:  I  understand.  Let  me  check  your  previous  medical  history...  You  mentioned  a  history  of

abdominal TB. Can you tell me more about that?

 Patient: I had treatment for abdominal TB for a year in Aziz Fatima Hospital. After that, I was stable

for about two years before the symptoms returned.

Doctor: Okay, thank you for that information. Let me now check your current examination findings.

Youve been showing signs of jaundice, pallor, and edema up to your ankles, correct?

Patient: Yes, thats right. Ive also had some difficulty breathing and Ive been feeling really tired.

Doctor: I see that your physical exam shows hepatomegaly, prominent veins, and mild to moderate

ascites. Well need to closely monitor your liver function and ascites management.

Patient:  Ive  been  following  my  medications,  as  advised.  Im  currently  on  Syrup  Paracetamol,

Lasoride, Aldactone, and a few others. Is this still the right treatment for me?

Doctor: Yes, your current medications seem appropriate for managing the condition. However, well

need to make some adjustments based on the latest lab results and radiological findings. Let me go

over those with you.

Doctor: Your recent lab results show that your bilirubin is 2.3, AST is 125, albumin is low at 2.2, and

your INR is elevated at 2.2. These all suggest liver dysfunction, and we need to continue managing

those with medications like albumin replacement. Your hemoglobin is also quite low at 8.4, and your

platelet count is 78, so we need to monitor for any bleeding risks.

Patient: I see. Is there anything else I need to be concerned about?

Doctor: Your livers condition is quite concerning, and I also want to highlight the findings from your

 recent radiological scans. Your ultrasound shows liver enlargement with hypertrophy of the caudate

lobe.  The  CT  scan  shows  signs  of  hepatomegaly,  with  a  narrowed  intrahepatic  IVC  and  features

consistent with Budd Chiari Syndrome.

Patient: Whats the plan moving forward?

Doctor:  Well  continue  your  medications,  but  we  are  considering  a  liver  transplant  as  the  definitive

treatment.  Well  discuss  this  in  our  multidisciplinary  team  (MDT)  meeting.  In  the  meantime,  well

discontinue the diuretics, monitor your lab results closely, and plan for an endoscopy to assess any

other potential issues.

Patient: That sounds serious. What do I need to do at home?

Doctor:  Youll  need  to  continue  your  current  medications  and  make  sure  you  follow  up  with  the

scheduled labs. We also recommend some additional support, such as taking Vitamin A, D, and E

drops,  and  ensuring  you're  on  the  MCT  oil  regimen.  Ill  also  prescribe  some  antibiotics  in  case  of

infection.

Patient: Thank you for explaining everything, doctor. Im a bit worried, but Ill follow your instructions

closely.

Doctor: I understand this is a lot to take in. We will be here every step of the way, and well ensure

you get the best care possible. Lets stay in touch and monitor your progress closely. Do you have

any other questions or concerns?

Patient: Not at the moment. Ill follow up as you suggested. Thank you.

 Impression: Budd Chiari Syndrome

Plan:

Discuss in MDT

Discontinue diuretics (Tablet Lasoride, Aldactone)

Follow up on Friday

Repeat baseline labs on follow-up

Screening endoscopy planned

Continue current medications

Parental counseling done

ImagingFindings: CT scan shows signs of hepatomegaly
ultrasound shows liver enlargement with hypertrophy of the caudate lobe

VisitTimeline: admitted for about 15 days at Childrens Hospital
treatment for abdominal TB for a year
